  • Classes in avdta.network.node used by avdta.network.node 
    Class and Description
    ConflictRegion
    This class represents a single conflict region in the conflict region model of reservation-based intersection control.
    Intersection
    An intersection in the traffic network.
    IntersectionControl
    This is an abstract class to implement intersection controls (Stops, Conflict Regions, Signals, etc.).
    Location
    This class stores the location and elevation of a node.
    Node
    An abstract node in the traffic network.
    NodeRecord
    This class is used to represent and manipulate the data associated with a Node.
    Phase
    This class implements a phase of a traffic signal.
    PhaseRecord
    A record of a Phase used to represent and manipulate the data used to construct a Phase.
    PriorityTBR
    This class represents a reservation-based intersection control in which Vehicle movement is determined by their priority.
    Signalized
    This interface specifies the methods and data needed for any intersection control that uses or mimics a traffic signal.
    TBR
    This is an abstract representation of reservation-based intersection control.
    Turn
    This class just defines a data type to store a turn i.e.
    TurningMovement
    This is a representation of a turning movement that passes through one or more ConflictRegions.
    TurnRecord
    A record of a Turn that assists in the representation and manipulation of PhaseRecord data.
    Zone
    This class represents a centroid, and is a type of Node.

    An abstract node in the traffic network.
    Phase
    This class implements a phase of a traffic signal.
    PhasedTBR
    This is a version of reservations in which vehicles with a green light get priority.
    PriorityTBR
    This class represents a reservation-based intersection control in which Vehicle movement is determined by their priority.
    Signalized
    This interface specifies the methods and data needed for any intersection control that uses or mimics a traffic signal.

    This is an abstract representation of reservation-based intersection control.
